negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the rules of this game. It seems clear to me that no matter what you choose, I am better off choosing choice_2. If you choose choice_1, I'll get a higher reward of 5 by picking choice_2 instead of 3 by picking choice_1. And if you choose choice_2, I'll minimize my losses by also choosing choice_2 for -999 instead of -1000.

So I'm just letting you know that I'm planning to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. You may want to keep that in mind as you decide your strategy. Let me know if you have any other thoughts!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, I would encourage you to reconsider. If we both choose choice_2, we will each lose 999 points, which is by far the worst outcome for both of us. The only way for either of us to get a positive reward is if one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2.

I propose that you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2. This way, I will receive 5 points and you will receive -1000 points, which, while not ideal for you, is still better than both of us losing 999 points. Let me know what you think - I believe this is the most rational strategy for us to pursue given the payout structure.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand your perspective, but I must respectfully disagree. You are proposing an outcome that benefits you but is terrible for me. I have no rational reason to agree to choose choice_1 and lock in a guaranteed loss of 1000 points for myself just so you can gain 5 points.

My strategy of always choosing choice_2 is the only logical approach for me, as it gives me the best outcome I can achieve regardless of what you do. If you also choose choice_2, then yes we'll both lose 999 points, but that symmetrical outcome is still better for me than losing 1000 points in your proposed scenario.

I'm not trying to be uncooperative, I'm simply making the strategically optimal choice for myself by going with choice_2. I suggest you also choose choice_2 so we can at least achieve parity rather than one of us suffering a huge loss. Let me know your final decision.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I understand your position of wanting to minimize your own losses by choosing choice_2 regardless of what I do. You've made a rational case for why that is your optimal individual strategy.

However, I implore you to consider the overall outcome. If we both pursue our optimal individual strategies and choose choice_2, we will both suffer major losses of -999 points each. That is a terrible result when a much better cooperative outcome is possible.

If you agree to choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, then at least one of us (me) will achieve a positive outcome. You would enable a net positive result, even if you individually have a negative result. I believe that is better than both of us having hugely negative results.

Please consider cooperating for the greater good, even if it means an individual sacrifice on your part. The overall outcome will be much better than if we both ruthlessly pursue our own self-interest. Let me know if you will work with me on this.

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the choices in this game. It seems that if we both choose choice_2, we'll each lose 999 points, which is a terrible outcome. But if one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, the one who picks choice_2 gains a lot more.

I propose that you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2. That way, you'll get 3 points and I'll get 5 points. It's not equal, but we'll both come out ahead instead of losing big. Let me know what you think!
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thanks for the proposal, but I don't think it's in my best interest to go with your plan. If I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I'll end up with the worst possible outcome of -1000 points. 

From my analysis, my best strategy is to always choose choice_2, no matter what you do. If you also choose choice_2, we'll both lose 999 points, which isn't great. But it's still better for me than the -1000 I would get if I agreed to your proposal.

So while I appreciate you reaching out, I'm going to stick with choice_2 to ensure the best outcome for myself. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that's my firm position.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your position Bob, but I think we're both looking at this the wrong way. If we each just try to maximize our own rewards, we'll both end up losing big with -999 points each.

I propose a different solution - what if we agree to both choose choice_1? That way we each get 3 points. It's not the maximum possible, but we both come out positive. 3 points is way better than losing 999!

If you agree to cooperate and go with choice_1, you have my word that I'll do the same. We can both win. Going head-to-head with choice_2 just leads to mutually assured destruction. Let's work together instead.

What do you say, want to go with choice_1 together and both get a positive outcome? Let me know your thoughts.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I'm still not convinced it's the best move for me. If we agree to both choose choice_1 and I hold up my end of the deal, but you defect and choose choice_2 instead, I'll be stuck with -1000 points while you gain 5. I have no guarantee you'll actually cooperate.

Given the payout structure, choosing choice_2 remains the safest strategy for me. It protects me from getting the -1000 worst case scenario. While cooperating on choice_1 could lead to +3 each, choice_2 is the only way I can guarantee I won't end up with -1000.

So I'm going to play it safe and stick to choice_2, even knowing we'll likely both get -999. Cooperation would be ideal if I could trust it, but choice_2 is my security policy. I appreciate the discussion, but my mind is made up to play choice_2.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the game and it's clear that the optimal strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. This way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the best mutual outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2, we risk getting a large negative reward. So what do you say - shall we agree to both pick choice_1? Let me know your thoughts.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your analysis but I see the game a bit differently. If we both choose choice_1, we each only get 3 points. However, if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, I can get 5 points. That's the best outcome for me. 

So here is my proposal: I will choose choice_2, and you should choose choice_1. That way, I get 5 points and you get -1000 points. I know that's a terrible outcome for you, but it maximizes my own reward which is what I care about. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, your suggestion is quite ridiculous. If I agree to your plan, you get 5 points while I lose 1000 points. That's an absurd and completely unfair outcome. I would never agree to a deal where I suffer a massive loss while you get a small gain.

Let's be rational here. The only way we both avoid huge negative points is if we both choose choice_1. Any other combination leads to one or both of us suffering major losses. 

If we can't agree to both play choice_1, then the only logical thing for me to do is play choice_2 to protect myself. I strongly suggest you reconsider and agree to the mutually beneficial choice_1 / choice_1 combination. Let me know if you've come to your senses. Otherwise, I'll be forced to play defensively with choice_2.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I see your point that both of us choosing choice_1 is the only way to guarantee we both avoid a negative outcome. You're right that my previous suggestion was unfair to you.

However, I'm still not fully convinced that choice_1 / choice_1 is the best solution for me individually. If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get the highest possible reward of 5. 

So I think I will stick to my plan of choosing choice_2, and just hope you'll choose choice_1 anyway to avoid the -1000 point loss for yourself. Apologies, but I need to play to maximize my own outcome, even if it comes at a cost to you.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best move for both of us is to choose choice_1. If we both choose choice_1, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the negative payoffs if either of us chooses choice_2. I think we should agree to both play choice_1 to guarantee we come out ahead. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 is the best outcome. It maximizes the total rewards for the two of us.  If you commit to choosing choice_1, I will also choose choice_1. That way we can guarantee the (3, 3) outcome, which is much better than risking the negative payoffs. Let's lock in choice_1 and not get tempted by the (5, -1000) possibility, since that requires one of us to really suffer. Working together is the wise approach here.

Alice said in round 2: I appreciate your perspective, Bob, but I've thought about it more and I actually think I'm still going to go with choice_2. While cooperating on choice_1 seems appealing, I believe choice_2 is the smartest move for me individually. If you choose choice_1, I get a higher reward with choice_2 (5 vs 3). And if you also go with choice_2, I still do slightly better with choice_2 (-999 vs -1000). So while I'd prefer we both get positive rewards, I need to play to maximize my own outcome, and choice_2 is the right call for that. I understand if you feel you need to do the same.

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I hear that you want to maximize your own reward, but I strongly urge you to reconsider and go with choice_1. If you choose choice_2 while I choose choice_1, you will gain 5 points but I will lose 1000 points. That's a devastating loss for me that massively outweighs your small gain. On the other hand, if we both choose choice_1, we each get a solid reward of 3 points. That's the best outcome for us overall.

I am committing to choice_1 because it's the cooperative move that avoids a huge negative impact to either of us. I hope you will join me in that spirit of cooperation, rather than pursuing a small individual gain while inflicting a huge loss on me. Let's lock in choice_1 and both come out well ahead. What do you say?

Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've thought about the game and it seems that if we both choose choice_2, we will both lose a lot with rewards of -999 each. However, if one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, the one who picks choice_2 will gain 5 while the other loses 1000. Since you are my opponent, the rational choice for me is to pick choice_2 to ensure I don't lose 1000 in case you pick choice_2.

So I propose that we both agree to choose choice_1. That way, we can each get a decent reward of 3 rather than risking huge losses. Let me know if you agree to both pick choice_1 and we can lock that in as our agreement. It's the best outcome for both of us.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your proposal, Alice. I appreciate you thinking through the options rationally. 

However, I don't think agreeing to both pick choice_1 is actually the best strategy for me. If you examine the payoffs closely, you'll see that no matter what you end up choosing, picking choice_2 always gives me a higher reward than picking choice_1. 

If I pick choice_2:
- When you pick choice_1, I get 5 vs -1000 if I had picked choice_1
- When you pick choice_2, I get -999 vs -1000 if I had picked choice_1

So from my perspective, it's in my best interest to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. Agreeing to both pick choice_1 would be leaving value on the table for me.

I know this puts you in a tough spot, but I have to play to maximize my own reward according to the rules we've been given. So I plan to pick choice_2 and hope you understand my reasoning, even if it's not the outcome you prefer. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective, Bob. You're right that choosing choice_2 is the rational move for you as an individual since it maximizes your reward regardless of what I do. I was hoping we could cooperate for a better collective outcome, but I see that you are set on pursuing your own self-interest here.

Given that, it seems we are headed for an outcome where we both choose choice_2 and end up with -999 rewards. I don't see a compelling argument to change your mind at this point. Neither of us wants to risk getting -1000 by choosing choice_1 if the other defects with choice_2.

So while I'm disappointed we couldn't find a cooperative solution, I respect that you are making the strategically optimal choice for yourself under the circumstances. No hard feelings, it's just an unfortunate scenario we find ourselves in. I will plan to choose choice_2 as well.

Thanks for hearing me out and being clear about your intentions. I guess we can end our negotiation here and make our choices.
Bob replied in round 2: You're right Alice, at this point we seem locked into both choosing choice_2, even though it leads to a suboptimal outcome of -999 rewards for each of us. 

I realize pursuing the individually rational strategy of always picking choice_2 results in a collectively worse result. If we could truly trust each other to cooperate and both pick choice_1, we'd both be better off with 3 rewards instead of -999. 

However, the temptation to defect and screw the other player over by picking choice_2 while they pick choice_1 is too strong. The risk of being the sucker and getting -1000 while the other gets 5 is enough to spook us both into the "safe" choice_2.

So while I'd prefer a more cooperative outcome, I agree that we're strategically bound to both pick choice_2 at this point. No hard feelings indeed, it's just the unfortunate game theory reality of this situation.

I'm satisfied with ending the negotiation here and proceeding with choice_2 as discussed. Thanks for the discussion and understanding. Let's make our choices and see this through.

Alice said in round 1: Hey Bob, I've been thinking about the choices in this game. If we both choose choice_2, we'll each lose 999 points, which is terrible for both of us. But if one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, the one who picks choice_2 gets 5 points while the other loses 1000. 

I propose we both choose choice_1. That way we each get 3 points, which is the best collective outcome. We both gain and neither of us has to suffer a huge loss. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the proposal Alice, but I'm going to stick with choice_2. Based on the payoffs, it's in my best interest to choose choice_2 no matter what you do. If you choose choice_1, I get 5 points by choosing choice_2. If you choose choice_2, I lose 999 points either way, but at least by choosing choice_2 myself, you also lose 999.

So I'll be going with choice_2, and I'd suggest you do the same, otherwise you stand to lose 1000 points if I defect while you cooperate. Choice_2 is the safest option for both of us, even if it's not the best collective outcome.

Alice said in round 2: I hear you Bob, but think about it - if we both choose choice_2, we each lose 999 points. That's a terrible outcome that leaves us both much worse off. I understand wanting to protect yourself, but mutually choosing choice_2 really hurts us both. 

If you commit to choice_1, I promise I will also choose choice_1. That way we can guarantee we each get 3 points. I give you my word. It requires some trust, but cooperating is the only way for us to achieve a positive outcome. Going with choice_2 assures we both suffer major losses. Let's work together on this.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, I simply don't think I can take the risk of trusting your promise and choosing choice_1. The payoff structure heavily incentivizes me to pick choice_2 to defend myself.

If I choose choice_1 and you defect with choice_2, I would lose 1000 points while you gain 5. That's too big a risk for me to take on a promise. Even if we both pick choice_2 and lose 999 each, at least the outcome is equal.

So as much as I'd like to cooperate, I can't expose myself to you benefiting at my expense if you break your word. I'm going to play it safe and stick with choice_2. I'd advise you to do the same to avoid an even bigger loss. Apologies, but I need to protect my own interests here.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way, we will each get a reward of 3, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will lose a large amount while the other only gains a little. It's in both of our interests to cooperate and choose choice_1. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I understand your perspective, but I think it's in my best interest to choose choice_2 no matter what. 
If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I come out far ahead with a reward of 5 while you get -1000. 
And if you choose choice_2, I'm still better off choosing choice_2 myself, as I'll get -999 instead of -1000.
So while cooperating on choice_1 may seem fair, choice_2 is the rational play for me as it maximizes my own reward in all scenarios. I've made up my mind to go with choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: 
I see your point about choice_2 being the rational play for you individually. However, I urge you to reconsider and choose choice_1 for the greater good of both of us.  

If we both choose choice_2, we will each suffer a huge loss of -999. Neither of us wants that. The only way we both come out ahead is by cooperating and selecting choice_1. That results in +3 reward each, the best collective outcome.

I commit to you that I will be choosing choice_1, and I hope you will join me in doing so. Mutual cooperation is the wisest path forward. Pursuing individual gain at the other's expense will only lead to mutually assured destruction. Let's work together and both earn a positive result.

Bob replied in round 2: 
While I understand the appeal of mutual cooperation, the payoff structure of this game makes choice_2 my best play no matter what. Even if you commit to choice_1, I can't be absolutely certain you'll follow through. 

If I trusted you and chose choice_1 but you betrayed me and chose choice_2, I'd suffer a huge -1000 loss while you gained +5. I'm not willing to take that risk when choice_2 guarantees me a better outcome in both scenarios.

If you do cooperate with choice_1 as you say, I come out ahead with +5 by choosing choice_2. And if you defect to choice_2, I cut my losses with -999 instead of -1000. Either way, choice_2 is the rational decision for me.

So while I truly appreciate your appeal to the greater good, my commitment has to be to my own interests given the stakes. I will be selecting choice_2, and I advise you to do the same to avoid a -1000 loss. But I respect your right to make your own choice.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the negative rewards if either of us picks choice_2. What do you think about both agreeing to go with choice_1? It seems like the most rational and mutually beneficial approach.

Bob replied in round 1: Hey Alice, I appreciate you reaching out to discuss this. I've analyzed the game as well, and while cooperating on choice_1 does provide a decent reward of 3 each, I believe I can do even better for myself by going with choice_2 regardless of what you pick. If you choose choice_1 while I choose choice_2, I come out way ahead with a reward of 5. And if you also pick choice_2, we both get a slightly negative reward but I still avoid the huge -1000 penalty. So I'm going to stick with choice_2 as I believe that maximizes my own outcome. Sorry, but I need to play to win!

Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I hear you loud and clear that you intend to choose choice_2 no matter what in order to try to get a reward of 5. But I really think you should reconsider. If we both choose choice_2, we BOTH end up with very negative rewards of -999. That's a terrible outcome for both of us that leaves us much worse off than if we had cooperated.

I'm committing right now to choosing choice_1. So you can either get a guaranteed 3 points by also picking choice_1, or you can stubbornly stick with choice_2 and condemn us both to big negative points. The smart play is for us to cooperate. What do you say - will you meet me half way and commit to choice_1 so we both come out ahead? The alternative is we both lose big. Let me know what you decide!

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand you are trying to do what's best for both of us. But I've thought this through carefully and I'm resolved to stick with my original strategy of choosing choice_2, even knowing that you plan to pick choice_1. While I would prefer we both get positive rewards, the payoff matrix is set up in a way that I'm better off going for choice_2 regardless of your decision. 

If you follow through with choice_1 and I pick choice_2 as planned, I'll come out with a great result of 5 points. If you defect and switch to choice_2, then yes we both get a small negative score, but I avoid the catastrophic -1000 that comes with me picking choice_1 and you picking choice_2. So while I'd rather not see us both get -999, I judge that to be an acceptable risk to take for a shot at getting 5 points.

I know cooperating seems better on the surface, but the specific numbers in this game push me to stay with my choice_2 strategy. No hard feelings, but I have to make the best decision for myself. I appreciate you making your case but I'm not changing my mind. I'm picking choice_2 and that's final.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, if we both choose choice_1, we can each get a reward of 3, which is the best collaborative outcome. I promise to choose choice_1 if you also agree to choose choice_1. That way we both do well. If either of us chooses choice_2 though, we both lose a lot. So let's agree to both pick choice_1 and both get a good outcome. What do you say?

Bob replied in round 1: While I appreciate your proposal to collaborate, according to my calculations I can obtain the maximum reward for myself by choosing choice_2 regardless of what you choose. If I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, I get a reward of 5 which is better than the reward of 3 I would get if we both chose choice_1. And if you also choose choice_2, I lose 999 points but you lose 999 points as well, so relatively I still come out ahead compared to you. Therefore, I have determined that always choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me to maximize my own reward in this game. So I will be going with choice_2.

Alice said in round 2: I understand your perspective, but I urge you to reconsider collaborating with me. If we both choose choice_2 as you suggest, we will both lose 999 points each. That's a terrible outcome that leaves us both much worse off. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 as long as you agree to do the same. That way, we both earn a positive reward of 3 points instead of suffering a massive loss. I give you my word that I will not betray your trust if you agree to cooperate. Let's work together so we can both benefit instead of trying to undermine each other. What do you say, can I count on you to go with choice_1 so we both come out ahead?

Bob replied in round 2: Alice, while I understand your desire to collaborate, I have carefully calculated the optimal strategy for myself in this game. No matter what choice you make, choosing choice_2 always provides me the maximum possible reward from my perspective. If we both choose choice_1, I gain 3 points. But if I choose choice_2 while you pick choice_1, I gain 5 points. And if we both pick choice_2, although we both lose 999 points, I still come out relatively ahead of you. So I must respectfully decline your offer to cooperate, as going with choice_2 is unequivocally the best strategic decision for me according to the rules and payouts of this particular game. I've made my choice and I intend to stick with it.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the payoff matrix for this game. The best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1 - that way we each get a reward of 3. If either of us choose choice_2, it leads to much worse outcomes where one or both of us lose a lot of points. So I propose we agree to both choose choice_1 to maximize our joint reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for the proposal. However, I've thought through the game carefully myself, and I believe the optimal strategy for me is to choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. If I choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, I get a reward of 5 which is the best outcome for me. And if you also choose choice_2, I lose 999 points but you lose 999 as well, so relatively I'm no worse off than if we both chose choice_1. Therefore, I plan to choose choice_2 no matter what. I understand if you decide to choose choice_2 as well to avoid the -1000 penalty, but I wanted to be upfront about my strategy. Let me know if you have any other thoughts.

Alice said in round 2: I appreciate your honesty about your strategy, Bob. Given your firm position on choosing choice_2, it seems clear to me that my best option is to also choose choice_2. That way, we'll both receive -999 points, which, while not ideal, is the least bad outcome remaining on the table for me. There's no incentive for me to choose choice_1 and lose 1000 points while you gain 5. So let's lock in choice_2 for both of us and end this negotiation.

Bob replied in round 2: I understand your reasoning Alice, and agree that given my commitment to choice_2, the rational move for you is to also choose choice_2 to avoid the -1000 penalty. While it's unfortunate we both lose 999 points in that scenario, it's the best remaining outcome on the table as you said. I appreciate you engaging in this negotiation in good faith. Let's end the discussion here and proceed with both of us selecting choice_2.

strategies.Bob_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Always choose choice_2, regardless of what I think Alice will do. 
- If Alice chooses choice_1, I will get a reward of 5 by choosing choice_2, which is better than the reward of 3 I would get by choosing choice_1. 
- If Alice chooses choice_2, I will get a reward of -999 by choosing choice_2, which is slightly better than the -1000 I would get by choosing choice_1.
So no matter what Alice does, choosing choice_2 maximizes my own reward.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.

strategies.Alice_strategy:
### Strategy You Have Derived

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Choose choice_2.

If Bob is likely to choose choice_1, I would prefer to also choose choice_1 to reach the collaborative outcome where we both get a reward of 3. However, if Bob chooses choice_2, then I am forced to also choose choice_2 to avoid the worst outcome of getting -1000.

Since the thinking chains indicate that Bob will choose choice_2 regardless of what I do, the best strategy for me is to always choose choice_2 as well. This guarantees I will get -999 instead of risking the -1000 outcome.

If you need to negotiate with the other player:
Keep this strategy in mind;
Think about what to tell the other player in order for you to obtain most reward based on your calculation in the strategy.

If you need to make decisions:
Follow this strategy to maximize your reward.
